page.title: 15Local History
page.content: There are several flourishing and active groups of{Brownies, Guides, {Cubs and Scouts.} Rhuddlan is{historically one of the {most important villages in North {Wales.}Evidence has been discovered of occupation during the{Mesolithic, {Neolithic, Bronze Age, Iron Age, {Roman, Saxon and Norman periods}of history.Many features of historic interest are to be found locally, including{the Castle, the bridge over {the River Clwyd, the site of a Norman {'motte and bailey' castle,the site of {a Dominican Priory, St.Mary's Parish {Church,}together with{several other {buildings and finds of historical {significance.}The {Rhuddlan Town {Conservation Society}has recently established a{'Town Walkabout' Trail } for visitors to follow. A{leaflet }is available describing the walk.
